formula: a(n) = 2*a(n-1) - a(n-2) + a(n-3) (holds at least up to n = 1000 but is not known to hold in general).
mathematica: RecurrenceTable[{a[0] == 5, a[1] == 9, a[n] == Ceiling[a[n - 1]^2/a[n - 2]-1/2]}, a, {n, 0, 40}] (* _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 04 2016 *)
prog: (MAGMA) Iv:=[5, 9]; [n le 2 select Iv[n] else Ceiling(Self(n-1)^2/Self(n-2)-1/2): n in [1..40]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 04 2016(PARI) lista(nn) = {print1(x = 5, ", ", y = 9, ", "); for (n=1, nn, z = ceil(y^2/x -1/2); print1(z, ", "); x = y; y = z;);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Feb 04 2016
crossrefs: It appears that this is a subsequence of A005314.
See A008776 for definitions of Pisot sequences.
author: _David W. Wilson_
